breakfast.title: Dutch Baby Pancakes
steps: Heat oven and skillet: Place a 10-inch cast-iron skillet (or another oven-safe pan) in the oven and preheat to 425°F.
Blend the batter: While the oven heats, combine the eggs, flour, milk, sugar, salt, and vanilla in a blender. Blend until the mixture is smooth.
Melt the butter: Carefully remove the hot skillet from the oven. Add the butter and swirl it around until it is completely melted and coats the bottom and sides of the pan.
Add batter and bake: Quickly pour the batter into the hot skillet. Return the skillet to the oven and bake for 15–20 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the pancake is puffed up.
Serve immediately: As soon as it comes out of the oven, the pancake will begin to deflate. Dust with powdered sugar and add any other desired toppings before slicing and serving.

breakfast.title: Egg Frittatas
ingredients: ½ cup milk, half-and-half, or heavy cream
½ teaspoon salt, ¼ teaspoon black pepper
1 cup of your choice of cheese, grated or crumbled
3 to 5 cups of chopped vegetables, greens, or cooked meats
steps: Prepare the Eggs: Whisk the eggs with the dairy, salt, and pepper until the yolks and whites are blended. Stir in the cheese.

Cook the Fillings: In a large oven-safe skillet, warm the olive oil over medium heat. Add onions or other dense vegetables first, followed by softer vegetables and then greens or garlic. Cook until tender.
Combine and Cook: Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables in the skillet.
Finish: You can finish the frittata by cooking it on the stovetop until the edges are set, or bake it in the oven until the center is cooked through.

breakfast.title: Granola Clusters
ingredients: Nuts & Seeds: Around 1 to 2 cups total (almonds, pecans, walnuts, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds)
Sweetener: 1/3 to 1/2 cup honey, maple syrup, or rice malt syrup.
Fat: 1/4 cup melted coconut oil, olive oil, or butter.
steps: Preheat: your oven to 180°C (350°F).
Mix: the oats, nuts, seeds, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl.
Combine: the melted oil, honey or maple syrup, and vanilla in a separate bowl, then pour it over the dry ingredients.
Stir: well until everything is evenly coated.
Spread: the mixture on a parchment-lined baking sheet and press it down firmly into a single, thick layer to encourage clumping.
Bake: for about 15 minutes.
Remove: the pan, stir to break up larger clumps, and press down again.
Bake: for another 10-15 minutes until golden brown.
Cool: completely in the pan to allow the clusters to harden.

breakfast.title: Pumpkin Pancakes
ingredients: 1 teaspoon: Ground cinnamon (or 1 to 1.5 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice)
¼ cup: Brown sugar (or white sugar)
2 tablespoons: Vegetable oil or melted butter
1 ¼ to 1 ¾ cups: Milk or buttermilk
steps: Mix dry ingredients. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, spices, and salt.
Combine wet ingredients. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk, pumpkin puree, egg, and melted butter.

Combine wet and dry. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry mixture. Gently fold them together with a spatula until just combined. Don't overmix; some lumps in the batter are fine. For a fluffier result, let the batter rest for 5 to 10 minutes.
Heat the pan. Place a griddle or large nonstick skillet over medium heat and lightly grease it with butter or cooking spray.
Cook the pancakes. Drop or pour the batter onto the hot pan, using about ¼ cup for each pancake.
Flip when ready. Cook for about 2 o 3 minutes, until bubbles form and pop on the surface and the edges look set.
Finish cooking. Flip the pancakes and cook for another 1 to 2 minutes, or until golden brown on the other side and cooked through.
Serve. Serve the pancakes warm with butter and maple syrup.

lunch.title: Chicken Grape Waldorf
ingredients: Chicken: 2 cups (cooked and cubed or shredded)
steps: In a large bowl, combine the cooked chicken, halved grapes, diced celery, chopped walnuts, and any optional additions like diced apple or red onion.
In a separate small bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, lemon juice, and salt and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the chicken mixture and stir gently to coat everything well.
Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the salad immediately or chill for at least one hour to allow the flavors to meld.

lunch.title: Mexican Tortellini Salad
ingredients: 9 to 10 ounces (1 package) fresh or frozen cheese tortellini
1 cup black beans, drained and rinsed
Protein (Optional): 1 cup diced grilled chicken or 15 to 20 shrimp
1/2 teaspoon chili powder or smoked paprika
Salt and black pepper to taste
(Optional) 1/4 cup finely grated or crumbled cheese, such as cotija or feta
steps: Cook Tortellini: Cook the tortellini according to the package instructions, then drain and let it cool completely.
Prepare Dressing: In a bowl, whisk together olive oil, lime juice, minced garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Combine Ingredients: In a large bowl, add the cooled tortellini, black beans, corn, tomatoes, red onion, bell pepper, cilantro, and avocado.
Dress the Salad: Pour the prepared dressing over the salad ingredients and gently toss to coat everything.
Add Protein: If using, add the grilled chicken or cooked shrimp to the salad.
Serve: Garnish with additional cilantro or cheese before serving, if desired.

lunch.title: Pasta Salad Bowl
ingredients: 16 ounces (1 lb) pasta: (such as rotini, penne, or fusilli)
8 ounces mozzarella cheese, cubed or mozzarella pearls
1/4 cup fresh herbs: like parsley or basil
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil.
Add the pasta and cook until it is tender but still has a slight firmness.
Drain the pasta in a colander.
Rinse the pasta with cold water to stop the cooking process and prevent the noodles from sticking together.
Transfer the pasta to a large bowl and toss with a tablespoon of olive oil to keep it from clumping. Let it cool completely.

lunch.title: Sweet Potato Salad Bowl
ingredients: 1 pound (about 1 medium) sweet potato, peeled and cubed
2 to 3 cups leafy greens (like baby spinach, arugula, or kale)
1/2 cup cooked grain (like quinoa or wild rice)
1/4 cup crumbled feta or goat cheese (optional)
1/4 cup toasted pumpkin seeds (pepitas) or walnuts
steps: Roast the Sweet Potatoes: Toss the sweet potato cubes with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread them in a single layer on a baking sheet and roast at 400°F (200°C) for 20-25 minutes, or until tender and slightly browned.
Prepare the Dressing: In a small jar or bowl, whisk together the olive oil, apple cider vinegar, honey, Dijon mustard, and salt and pepper until well combined.
Assemble the Bowl: In a large bowl, combine the leafy greens, cooked grain, and the roasted sweet potatoes. Add the red onion and dried cranberries.
Add the Toppings: Sprinkle the crumbled feta or pepitas over the salad.
Drizzle and Toss: Drizzle the Honey Mustard Dressing over the salad and toss everything together gently.
Serve: Transfer the salad to bowls and serve immediately

dinner.title: Chicken and Chickpea Salad
ingredients: Chicken: 2 cups cooked and diced chicken breast
Chickpeas: 1 can (15 ounces), rinsed and drained.
Tomatoes: 1-2 cups cherry or grape tomatoes, halved.
Red Onion: ¼ cup diced red onion, or about half a small red onion.
Lemon Juice: Juice of half to one lemon.
Fresh Herbs: 1-2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley or mint.
steps: Prepare the vinaigrette. Whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, garlic powder, and honey (if using) in a small bowl. Set the dressing aside.
Chop the vegetables. Dice the cooked chicken, chop the mini cucumbers, halve the cherry or grape tomatoes, and dice the red onion.
Rinse the chickpeas. Drain and thoroughly rinse the canned chickpeas.
Combine the salad ingredients. In a large bowl, mix the chicken, chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, olives, and fresh parsley.
Toss with the dressing. Pour the prepared vinaigrette over the salad mixture. Toss everything together gently until well-coated.
Add the feta. Gently fold in the crumbled feta cheese and oregano (if not added to the dressing) just before serving.

dinner.title: Broiled Salmon
steps: Preheat: the oven to high broil.
Prepare: the salmon by placing it on a baking sheet lined with foil for easy cleanup.
Coat: the fillets with olive oil.
Season: with salt, pepper, and any other chosen spices or herbs.
Broil: the salmon for about 8-10 minutes, or until cooked through, checking frequently to prevent too much browning.

dinner.title: Dijon Chicken
ingredients: Chicken: 1 to 1.5 pounds of boneless, skinless chicken breasts or bone in thighs.
Fat: 1 to 2 tablespoons of olive oil and/or butter.
Dijon Mustard: 1 to 3 tablespoons, depending on how strong you want the flavor.
Liquid: 1/2 to 3/4 cup of heavy cream, chicken broth, or white wine.
Seasoning: Salt and pepper to taste.
steps: Prepare the chicken: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper and pound them thin for even cooking.
Sear the chicken: Heat oil and butter in a skillet, then sear the chicken until golden brown.
Sauté aromatics: Add garlic and/or shallots to the pan and cook until softened.
Create the sauce: Deglaze the pan with white wine or broth, then whisk in the Dijon mustard and add cream, herbs, or other liquids.
Combine and serve: Return the chicken to the pan, simmer until cooked through, and pour the sauce over the chicken.

dinner.title: Italian Lentil Soup
ingredients: 1 to 2 cups dried brown or green lentils.
Liquid: 4 to 8 cups vegetable or chicken broth
steps: Sauté the aromatics. In a pot, cook the diced onion, carrot, and celery in olive oil until soft and fragrant. Add the minced garlic and cook for one more minute.
Add lentils and tomatoes. Stir in the rinsed lentils, crushed tomatoes, and dried herbs like rosemary and oregano.
Pour in the broth and simmer. Add vegetable or chicken broth and a bay leaf. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer.
Cook until tender. Partially cover the pot and let it simmer for 20–30 minutes, or until the lentils are soft.
Season to taste. Remove the bay leaf and season the soup with salt, pepper, and optional red pepper flakes.
Garnish and serve. Ladle the soup into bowls. Top with fresh parsley, grated Parmesan cheese, and a drizzle of olive oil, and serve with crusty bread.

drink.title: Banana Muffins
ingredients: Flour: 1.5 to 2 cups (all-purpose or self-raising flour)
Bananas: 3 large ripe bananas, mashed (about 1.5 to 1.75 cups)
Butter: 1/4 to 1/2 cup, melted or oil
Sugar: 1/2 to 3/4 cup white sugar and/or 1/4 cup packed light brown sugar
Leavening: 1 teaspoon baking soda and/or 1 teaspoon baking powder
steps: Prepare the wet ingredients. In a large bowl, mash ripe bananas. Add the melted butter, sugars, eggs, and vanilla, and mix well.
Mix the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt to ensure they are evenly combined.
Combine the mixtures. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Fold them together with a spatula just until combined, being careful not to overmix.
Fill and bake. Spoon the batter into a greased or lined muffin tin, filling each cup about two-thirds full. Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for 25 to 30 minutes.

drink.title: Chickpea, Date and Cashew
ingredients: Chickpeas: About 1 cup of cooked chickpeas.
Dates: 1 cup of pitted, seedless dates.
Cashews: 1/2 to 1 cup of raw or roasted cashews.
Nut Butter: 1/4 cup (30g) of peanut butter, almond butter, or cashew butter.
Sweetener: 2 tablespoons of honey or maple syrup.
Flavor: 1 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon.
Seeds: 2 tablespoons of flaxseeds or chia seeds for extra nutrition.
Chocolate: Dark or white chocolate chips for a touch of indulgence.
Salt: A pinch of salt to enhance the flavors.
steps: Combine the drained chickpeas and dates in a food processor and blend until a thick paste forms.
Add the cashews, oats, and any other desired ingredients into the food processor.
Process until the mixture is well combined and sticky.
Roll the mixture into bite-sized balls or press it into a lined baking pan.
Chill the bites in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.

drink.title: Flapjacks
steps: Preheat: your oven to 150°.
Line: a 20cm square baking tin with baking paper.
Melt: the butter in a medium pan over low heat.
Add: the golden syrup and sugar to the butter and heat gently, stirring until the sugar dissolves.
Remove: the pan from the heat and stir in the porridge oats and optional ground ginger until everything is coated.
Transfer: the mixture to the prepared tin and press down firmly.
Bake: for 20 to 25 minutes.

drink.title: Ricotta Pots
ingredients: Heavy Cream: 1 cup of heavy cream makes the ricotta creamier and richer.
Acid: 3 tablespoons of fresh lemon juice or white vinegar to curdle the milk.
Salt: A pinch or to taste.
steps: Combine the ricotta, honey, and cinnamon in a bowl and mix until smooth.
Gently stir in most of the fresh blueberries.
Divide the mixture between two serving pots or ramekins and chill until ready to eat.
Top with the remaining blueberries and drizzle with extra honey just before serving.

snack.title: Berry Good Smoothie
ingredients: Frozen Berries: 3 cups of mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, blackberries).
Liquid: ½ cup to 1 cup of milk (regular, almond, or soy milk) or fruit juice.
Yogurt: ½ cup of plain or berry-flavored yogurt.
steps: Combine the frozen mixed berries, frozen banana, liquid, and yogurt in a blender.
Add any optional sweeteners or ice at this point.
Blend until the mixture is smooth and creamy.

snack.title: Mango Morning Smoothie
ingredients: 1 to 1.5 cups: chopped mango (fresh or frozen)
½ to ¾ cup: milk (dairy or non-dairy) or plain yogurt
steps: Add ingredients to blender: Place the mango, banana, milk or yogurt, and any optional additions into a blender.
Blend until smooth: Blend on high speed until the mixture is smooth and creamy.

snack.title: Avacado and Berry Smoothie
ingredients: Avocado: 1/2 to 1 medium-sized avocado, pitted and peeled, for creaminess.
Berries: 1 to 1 ½ cups of frozen mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, or blackberries).
Liquid: 1 cup of milk (dairy, almond, soy, or oat) or water.
steps: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend on high speed until the mixture is smooth and creamy.

snack.title: Beet the Blues Smoothie
ingredients: Beets: 1-2 small cooked or raw beets, peeled and diced
Berries: 1 cup frozen blueberries or a mix of blueberries and raspberries
Liquid: 1/2 to 1 cup water, coconut milk, almond milk, or unsweetened cranberry/apple juice
Ginger: A small knob or 1-2 tablespoons of grated fresh ginger
Greens: 1-2 handfuls of spinach or kale
steps: Combine all ingredients in a blender.
Blend on high speed until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
